Overview

Kantata provides a multi-currency feature, allowing foreign markets to utilize project and resource cost rates in their local currencies. Each currency has its own symbol, ISO code, name, and format.

Currency Format

Each currency in Kantata OX has a specific format that determines where the decimal separator is located, which type of separator is used, and where the currency symbol appears.

The majority of currencies in Kantata OX use a “.” as the decimal separator. However, certain currencies use a “,” as the separator. For example, an amount of 199.99 is formatted as $199.99 in USD but 199,99 € in EUR.

To determine the format for a specific currency, please refer to the Format column in the table below.

Note: There currently isn’t an option to configure localization formatting in Kantata OX.

Exporting Currencies

When exporting financial data to a CSV or Excel file in Analytics, all currency fields will export using “.” as the default decimal separator in the currency columns. This is done to ensure that the currencies will display in your preferred localization preference when opening the exported document in a spreadsheet software.

Note: You may need to first set your preferred localization preference in your spreadsheet software to utilize this option.
